meanings.definition: To fasten or secure a button again.
meanings.sent1: She rebuttoned her coat before going outside.
meanings.sent2: He always rebuttoned his shirt after doing laundry.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear rebuttoned its eye after it fell off.
meanings.sent4: The detective rebuttoned the evidence together to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: The student rebuttoned the mistake in their essay to make it perfect.

meanings.definition: Having buttons that have been fastened again.
meanings.sent1: The rebuttoned jacket looked as good as new.
meanings.sent2: She wore a rebuttoned dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The rebuttoned pillow felt extra secure.
meanings.sent4: The rebuttoned gloves kept her hands warm in the snow.
meanings.sent5: The rebuttoned shirt was a great find at the thrift store.
